article.title: A Markov Chain Theory Approach to Characterizing the Minimax Optimality of Stochastic Gradient Descent (for Least Squares)

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the: *L(w) = 1/2 E_(x,y)~D[(y - w•x)²]*
choices: Update rule for stochastic gradient descent

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula defines the: *w* := argmin_w L(w)*
choices: Gradient of the loss function at a specific point
Expected value of the input data
Optimal weight vector that minimizes the loss function

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the: *w_t = w_(t-1) + γ(y_t – w_(t-1) • x_t)x_t*
choices: Update rule for the weight vector in stochastic gradient descent
Definition of the optimal learning rate
Calculation of the gradient of the loss function
The MLE estimator always converges to the true optimum.
The difference between the expected loss of the MLE estimator and the true minimum converges to the statistically optimal rate.
The statistical rate of the MLE estimator is always equal to 1.
The MLE estimator is not suitable for large sample sizes.
